en-US.Variant: The application requested an OpenGL context of version {0}.{1} or higher, but the driver could not provide such a context.
No supported graphics device was found.
Unsupported shader type.
Unsupported data type.
Unsupported element type.
Unsupported image type.
Unsupported vertex format.
Unsupported index format.
Unsupported primitive type.
The specified data is too large to be contained by this buffer.
No geometry stream has been set.
The current geometry stream is invalid.
No effect has been set.
Invalid texture.
Invalid kerning pair.
The specified render target is not ready for rendering because no render buffers are attached.
The specified render target is not ready for rendering because its framebuffer is not complete: {0}
A render buffer cannot be used as a texture while it is bound to the device for writing.
The specified render buffer is not valid for this operation because it was created with the RenderBufferOptions.WillNotBeSampled flag.
The size of the specified render buffer does not match the size of this render target.
The resource cannot be read because it is currently bound for writing.
The resource cannot be written because it is currently bound for reading.
The resource is not bound to the device.
The value of {0} in Ultraviolet's cache of OpenGL state values is stale. Is external code modifying the OpenGL context?
The uniform '{0}' is defined multiple times with different types.
The expected effect parameter '{0}' does not have a corresponding shader uniform. Has it been optimized out?
An immutable value can only be set once.
Invalid effect pass.
The specified document does not contain an effect definition.
An effect must have at least a vertex shader and a fragment shader.
An effect must have at least one technique.
An effect technique must have at least one pass.
The specified technique belongs to a different effect.
Cannot enable debug output because GL_ARB_debug_output is not supported by the current driver.
Cannot set the shader uniform because it has no data source.
The specified FillMode parameter is not supported under the OpenGL ES profile.
The specified level of detail bias is not supported under the OpenGL ES profile.
The specified content archive contains invalid data.
The render buffer cannot be resized because it has been attached to a render target. Resize the render target instead.
The specified operation is invalid for this texture because it is using immutable storage. You can disable immutable storage for this texture in Texture2D.CreateTexture().

The specified operation is invalid for this render buffer because it is using immutable storage. You can disable immutable storage for this buffer by passing the appropriate RenderBufferOptions flags to RenderBuffer2D.CreateRenderBuffer().
The specified operation is invalid because the render buffer is already attached to a render target.
The included shader resource '{0}' could not be found.
The #include directive is not supported in shaders which are loaded from in-memory streams.
Instanced rendering is not supported by the current OpenGL driver.
Double-precision vertex attributes are not supported by the current OpenGL driver.
Integer vertex attributes are not supported by the current OpenGL driver.
A non-zero base instance value is not supported by the current OpenGL driver.
Sampler "{0}" does not refer to a valid uniform.
Sampler "{0}" cannot be set to index {1} because that index is already in use.
Implicit effects must be loaded from either *.frag or *.vert files; asset "{0}" is neither.
Shader extern has a name which is missing or invalid.
Graphics configuration is missing or is not derived from OpenGLGraphicsConfiguration.
The specified effect technique is already associated with an implementation.
The specified effect pass is already associated with an implementation.
The specified effect pass is not associated with an effect.
